summary:
The Napoleonic Wars were a series of battles between France, led by Napoleon Bonaparte, and various European countries. These wars started because of the French Revolution and gave France control over much of Europe. There were many battles, with different coalitions forming to fight Napoleon.

Napoleon invaded Russia in 1812, but it was a disaster for his army. After this, countries like Britain, Austria, and Russia formed an alliance and defeated Napoleon in 1814. He returned briefly in 1815 but was finally beaten at the Battle of Waterloo and sent to Saint Helena, where he died. These wars changed Europe's politics and started new ideas like nationalism.
title: Napoleonic Wars
